text: Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate maple coconut aroma. Roasted malty chocolate maple vanilla and coconut flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate maple coconut vanilla finish.

Czarne, piana kawowa redkująca się po minucie do 2 mm obrączki, bez koronkowania. Aromat: mistrzowie wypieków piwnych znowu wkroczyli - lody śmietankowe, kawa, mleczna czekolada, syrop klonowy, troszkę kokosa. Smak to syrop klonowy, podlany oleistą i roztopioną czekoladą kokosową, wanilią, duzo kakao, niesamowite! Słodkie, syrpowate, potężne ciało, a jednocześnie niewyczuwalny alkohol sprawia, że piłby i piłbym. Najlepsze Omni, choc wersja BA zaraz niedługo przede mną.

Bottle at tasting. Black oily pour. Aroma of vanilla, marshmallows, mocha chocolate, cocos, coffee and caramel fudge. Taste has rich mocha chocolate, cocos, maple, caramel fudge, soft creamy coffee and a boozy sweet finish. Delicious and simply fantastic.
Really dark, almost no carbonation. Classily roasty aroma with a hint of cocoa. Bitter but not vulgar. Really nice.
Słodkie, klejące i mocno kokosowe. Duża intensywność smaków, typowo deserowe, bardzo dobre.

Bottle, shared by Meilby. A jet black beer with a dark tan head of moderate size. Rather oily pour. Some lacing. Lots of maple syrup in the aroma, roasted malts, coffee, more coffee, dark sugars and some vanilla. Its full-bodied, sticky-sweet, lightly warming, smooth and with a low level of carbonation. Sort of oily. Roasted malts, maple syrup, coffee, dark sugars, hints of vanilla and coconut and a pleasant bitterness to deal with at least some of the sweetness in the flavor. Lasting finish with shitloads of maple syrup. Sure not a beer to drink a lot of if you want to avoid diabetes, but its damn tasteful. 170604

Bottle 330ml @ yngwie
Pours black with small tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, maple syrup, coconut, chocolate, caramel, toffee, alcohol and vanilla. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, roasted coconut, vanilla, chocolate, maple and caramel finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

30.05.2017, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is rich and sweet, dark sugar, dark malts, maple syrup, caramel, toast, roasted nuts, toasted coconut, minerals, roasted grain, chocolate, alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet mineraly, dark sugar, grass, minerals, toast, alcohol, bark, chocolate pudding, roasted grain, sour coffee, nuts, caramel, toasted coconut. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mineraly and sweet syrupy mouthfeel. Nice.

Monthly bottle share at Chez Sophie: 22nd May 2017. Four way split. Cheers Simon for the 33cl bottle: wish it could have been a bigger one. What a truly lovely beer. Tan coloured topping on a dark body that oozed richness and slickness from the malts within its make up. Really pleased the Coconut is understated because I prefered the sweetness without the Bounty feel. An exceptional beer to finish the night on. Not scored many beers as high as this!

330ml bottle @ monthly tasting, Chez Sophie, courtesy of Simon. Thanks Simon. Pours extremely dark with deep tan head. Aroma is quite something. Gorgeous caramel, milk chocolate and biscuit has an alluring effect. Taste is smooth, moderately rich with all these elements emerging. Coconut wasnt too prominent, although this was the last beer of our tasting so I might perhaps get more on a fresh palate. Regardless, this is an exceptional beer thats right up my street.

Piwa tego browaru są po prostu prze genialne jeśli chodzi o aromat. Masa syropu klonowego, czekolady i opiekanego kokosa. Mleczna czekolada w tle, wanilia. Ze szkła mocniej daje kokosem. Niuchałbym godzinami. Barwa czarna, piana beżowa, drobniuteńka. W smaku mocno czuć kokos i syrop klonowy na pierwszym planie. Masa syropu klonowego. Wanilia, mleczna czekolada, kakao, kawa. Bardzo złożone, wielowymiarowe. Alkohol delikatnie rozgrzewający. Wyklejające, może nawet trochę za słodkie. Dużo się dzieje, szczególnie w aromacie, w smaku również jest bardzo dobrze. Więcej ciała, trochę intensywniejsza wanilia i czekolada i byłaby już całkowita masakra. I tak jest bardzo dobrze.

Kolor:  Nieprzejrzyście czarny, trochę za ciemny jak na portera. 
 Piana:  Całkowity brak piany. Zerowe wysycenie. Przez sekundę pojawił się milimetrowy krążek, który zaraz zniknął w ciemnych czeluściach trunku. 
 Zapach:  Pierwszy niuch i ponownie jestem na tropikalnej wyspie. Poprzednim razem znalazłem się tam degustując Anagram z Omnipollo.
Tym razem aromat jest totalnie zdominowany przez syrop klonowy. 
Pachnie intensywnie aż przypominają mi się amerykańskie pancakes;) Pod spodem mamy nuty wanilii, świeżo startego kokosa i odrobina czekolady mlecznej.
Uwielbiam ten aromat. Wypełnia całe pomieszczenie i unosi się wysoko ponad butelką. 
 Smak:  W smaku całkowity brak nut palonych, więc jest jak najbardziej charakter Porterowy. 
Potężna porcja syropu klonowego.
Na przeciwległym biegunie nuty kokosa i wanilii.
Nie są one już tak jednoznaczne jak w aromacie.
Daleko na szarym końcu mleczna czekolada, karmel i dość sporo kakao.
Goryczka jest niska, zerowe wysycenie. Alkohol gładki, ładnie ukryty. Tekstura umiarkowana.
Bardzo fajny trunek. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  <br//

Ciekawy Imperial Porter nafaszerowany syropem klonowym, wanilią i kokosem.
Pachnie obłędnie, jak większość mocnych piw z Omnipollo.
Smak nie podąża aż tak bardzo za aromatem. Nie można mu natomiast niczego złego zarzucić. Trunek jest warty polecenia dla wszystkich kochających sztuczne aromaty ;)

16/20 can taste the maple, not the coconut so much. Still lovely, so smooth, really tasty, still has that synthetic sugary taste some of the omnipollo has but the maple helps with that

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Chmielarnia Marszalkowska. Z: czekolada, orzech mleko, syrop klonowy, orzechy, kokos jakis mullermilch na sterydach. S: intensywna kawa, czekolada, klon, orzech. No kurde magia.
W aromacie kokos, syrop klonowy, kawa, praliby czekoladowe. W smaku sporo słodyczy. Jest wanilia, syrop klonowy, cudowna kawa i czekolada. Naprawdę pyszne.

Bottled. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, coconut, roasted malt, and a bit of alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, alcohol, coconut, and chocolate, leading to a dry chocolate finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - Black pour with tan head. Sweet and toasted malty aroma and taste with prominent caramel and maple coming in, some chocolate, some nice nutty notes, rich opulent chocolate, nice vanilla and coconut caress into the finish.
33 cl. bottle. A balck beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of a malt, caramel, coconuts, sirup, roasted notes, chocolate and sweetness.
33 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is toffee, labre laver, caramelish and chocolate. Dense roasted malty. Solid toffee and caramelish. Toasted malty and roasted finish.

Pours black with low brown head
Aromas of bouron, vanilla sugar, hints of coconut and maple syrup, roastd malts, coffee, chocolate
Taste has notes of bourbon, vanilla, caramel, chocolate, hints of coffee, dark fruits, maple syrup and coconut
Mouthfeel is creamy an velvety smooth with medium bodym average carbonation and low bitterness

What a beautiful Porter! The aroma can not get much better than this, with the maple-caramel scent. Not much head, so the appearance could have been better. The taste, sweet, maple syrup, caramel, coffee, coconut... A bit sticky, the palate is, quite massive. Overall a wonderful experience.
Bottle from Linus - Pours a dark black with a brown head. Nose is full of maple syrup, coconut, chocolate. Taste is fudge, lots of coconut. Decadent and sweet.
Podrasowane na maksa. W aromacie sernik lodowy. Wanilia, owoce i ciasto. Praktycznie bez piany. Puszysta konsystencja. Kremowo i mleczne. Wspaniałe rozgrzewa. I live this game.

Bottle at home.
Pitch black coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel, coconuts and chocolate.
Sweet and roasted flavour of caramel, chocolate and coconuts.
Roasted finish.
Wspaniałe, idealnie wymierzone piwo. Czekoladowe, deserowe, rozkoszne.
BGM Backlog. Milk chocolate, coconut, maple syrup, nuts. Heavy sweet taste.
Bottle. Simply pralines in liquid form. Caramel, nougat, nuts, cocoa and biscuits notes mixed in a form of delicious dessert. Syrupy, sweet and smooth and soft mouthfeel.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 15th November 2020. Poured into a snifter. It was black in colour with a thin brown head that dissipated quickly but left spotty lacing. Aromas of biscuit, roasted coconut, hazelnut, maple syrup, milk chocolate and vanilla with a hint of booze. Tastes of sweet maple syrup, vanilla, biscuit and caramel with hints of chocolate and fudge plus a light boozy finish. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall a nice sweet Imperial Porter. For me I would rank Yellow Belly > Noa > Lorelei > Anagram. But really all four were good.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2017 Bottle at home, great design. Pitch black, thick topped by a brown creamy head. Great nose, despite the typical Omnipollo lightly chemical sweet note. Rich milky coffee and chocolate, maple syrup, toasted marshmallow, caramel, hazelnut, creamy, vanilla, faint coconut: sweet roasted malts, no real bitterness in the finish. Lingering aftertaste. Big body, low carbonation, soft mouthfeel.

Bottle, 10.5%. Black with tiny brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, nuts, coconut, caramel and maple syrup. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, nuts, caramel, sweet, maple syrup, little coconut, warming, notes of alcohol, hop, sticky and medium bitter.
Kolsvart med ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar sirap, choklad och kaffe. Lite tunn

33cl-fles van bij Saveur Bière. U: Zwart met een grote donkerbruine schuimkraag. G: Hazelnoot, mokka, chocolade en vanille. S: Zoet met een lichte moutbitterheid. Hazelnoot, wat lactose, vanille, chocolade. M: Volmondig, lichte carbo en sticky. Echt lekker!
Maple sirup aroma but Im not fan of that. Too sweet for me. Not the best of Omnipollo but good
Dessert! Ietwat te zoet voor mij, waardoor net geen absolute top. Veel Maple en weinig coconut, Vanille met een vleugje vanille. Chocolade, nog meer maple. Heel vol en romig. Top.

Draft glass @ Gollem. Black, collapsing very deep mocha head. Nose is like liquid pralines, hazlenut, mocha, vanilla, mocha ice cream, maple,... Smells like Noa with pralines added. Taste is basically Noa with liquid pralines, melted chocolate, mocha, some vanilla, mocha ice cream, liquid mocha, low condensed milk, lactose, maple, faintest booze, hazelnut,... Body is thick pralines, thick as hell. Getting some vanilla but no real coconut. This is an improved Noa, this beer tastes like liquid pralines, brilliant. Really spectacular. It would be greedy to ask for more.
Bottle @ shelfie tasting @ Fermentoren. Pitch black pour with a dark tan head. Notes of roasty, tons of chocolate, milky sweet, vanilla fudge, light maple and hints of coconut.

Tap at gollem. Pours black, good grey head. Smell is thick, black malts, vanilla, intense. Taste is thick, roasted malts. Chocolate, vanilla, very hidden coconut. Sweet, but balanced. Extremely full. Sooo nice !

Bottle. It pours opaque black with a creamy beige head. The aroma is coconut, syrup and toffee caramel. Peanut butter and chocolate. Milked coffee. Sweet roasted flavor with notes of caramel and coconut. Light coffee and sweet chocolate. Lots by sweet roasted finish. Bitter chocolate notes.
Draft - Crazy sweet maple syrup. Jet black with no head. Sweet maple syrup, vanilla and some sweet roast. Crazy sweet and mapley? Much too sweet.
On tap. Blakc colour with beige head. Chocolate and caramel aroma. Chocolate, caramel, milk, sweet, maple and pastry taste. Medium to full body.

Bottle. Pours a sirup thick black color with a tan head, that dissappears a bit fast. Aroma is huge of caramel, sweet coconut, vanilla, ice cream and biscuit. Taste is beautifully balanced, not sickening sweet like some maple porters can be. I would prefer a tad more bitterness though. But taste is of dark chocolate, vanilla and creamy coconut and caramel. Fantastic beer!

Doftar lite kokos och sirap. Väldigt ting doft. 
Smaken är lite för söt och klibbig men på hela taget god. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Väldigt söt doft av kokoschoklad och chokladlikör. Tung, kraftigt söt, smak med tydliga kokostoner och vissa alkoholtoner i eftersmaken. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Az Omnipollo sörei messzi földön híresek az elrugaszkodott, már az elnevezés alapján is gasztronómiai kalandtúrának ható ízvilágukról, a Lorelei sem lóg ki túlságosan a sorból a maga kókuszos, juharos vonalaival. Illatra egyszerűen fenomenális, tömény kókuszkrém karamellel átszőve, csokoládé -, és juharszirupos jegyekkel bőségesen meglocsolva. Mennyei, csemegeszerű aromák, folyékony desszertek krémes felhőcskéi. Az ízvilág ehhez képest némileg élesíti a képet, sűrű, apró szemű szénsavháló hegyezi ki kissé az ízjegyeket. A mannaszerű hatás természetesen nem marad abba, csupán a szirupos, olajos szerkezetet érezzük enyhén megszellőztetettnek, kikönnyítettnek ezáltal. A csokoládé bársonyos eleganciája, a juharszirup fás, fűszeres pikantériája, s a kókusz vaníliával kevert krémessége itt is jelen van, izgalmas teltségével egyszerűen nem lehet betelni, a medvecukros, komlós kesernyével átitatott végjáték pedig hosszú perceken át gondoskodik a főzet utóéletéről is. Soha nem lepleztem gyengéd érzelmeimet a vattacukor fokozatúra hangolt édességű imperial stoutok iránt, amit ha példával kellene alátámasztanom, valószínűleg ez a sör is eszembe jutna. Esetében azonban némileg árnyaltabb a kép, ami nem kis mértékben a szögletes élekkel rendelkező, a gyermekien játékos stílust végül markánssá hangoló, néhol száraz, néhol füstös, máshol karcos és vadóc, az összbenyomásokat színesítő, más szemszögből nézve azok értékét kicsit talán még le is rontó utóízének köszönhető. Mindezzel együtt természetesen köröket ver nagyon sok (a legtöbb?) imperial stoutra.

From bottle at Dangerous bottleshares Shelfie and dåsebajer edition. Pours a a pitch black with a tiny brown head. Aroma has lots of hazelnuts, very toasted coconut, skildpadder, dark chocolate, caramel, light roasty malts, classic Omnipollo labre larver. Taste is sweet, roasty, slight coconut and a nice, dark chocolaty bitter finish. Pretty full bodied and a rather low carbonation.

Pours pitch black with a dark brown head. Aroma of hazelnuts, faint coconut, maple, coffee, chocolate, "labre larver" and vanilla ice cream. Taste of maple, hazelnut, definitely more roast here, cocoa beans, more bitter coffee and coconut. More bitter and roasted in the taste than in the aroma. But dontt get carried away. This is still freaking good!

Piana brązowa, sycząca, szybko opada do zera. Barwa prawie czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat intensywny, słodki, nieco sztuczny, aczkolwiek przyjemny - trufle, kakao, toffi, karmel i odrobina wiórków kokosowych w tle. W smaku przyjemnie oleiste, dość słodkie, czekoladowe, kawowe, do tego jest sporo lekko słonawego karmelu, toffi, cukierków Irys. Niska goryczka, niska paloność, niskie do średniego, drobniuteńkie wysycenie, aksamitne i gładkie w odbiorze z całkiem przyzwoitą gęstością. Alkohol perfekcyjnie ukryty.

Kokosa niewiele poza niedużą nutką w zapachu, w smaku jeszcze mniej, syrop klonowy chyba bardziej wyczuwalny jako karmel i toffi. Jakaś obca, lekko chemiczna nuta gdzieś się niby pałętała na początku degustacji, ale po kilku łykach piwo po prostu potrafi urzec przyjemną fakturą, słodyczą i kremowością. Dla mnie jedno z lepszych piw Omnipollo!

Released in Sweden January 20, 2017. 
ABV: 10.5% 

The beer pours pitch black with a thin brown head with almost no lacing. 

Nose: Oh! Ah! Wow! 
Peanut (shouldnt be in here?), cookies, milk chocolate, maple syrup, coconut, fudge, vanilla, dark bread, cocoa powder and hazelnut. 
Taste: Coconut, fudge, chocolate, syrup, roasted malt, vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee and hazelnut. 
Mouth: Full body. Light carbonated. Smooth, silky feeling. Oily. Rich texture. Dry but sweet ending. 

This is so good! Almost to good! Is like when you were little and got a to big bag of candy from your grandparents and you ate it all...
Omnipollo just nails these black beauties every time. Coconut, maple syrup, vanilla, chocolate, ice cream.

duft stor kraftig vanilje duft. chokolade karamel kremeret fyldig duft 
smag vanilje ristet malt stor sødme stor fylde varm.

From bottle shared at Ratebeer Best awards and bottle-share. Thanks Magnus! Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, caramel, chocolate, cocoa, spicy, vanilla, coconut. Moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.

czarne, niemal od nalania piana zerowa. w aromacie kokos, mleczna czekolada, skojarzenia z pankejkami jak najbardziej na miejscu, kakao. w smaku słodkie, wyklejające, nisko nasycone, alkoholowe, długi palony finisz.

(bottle)
Aroma:intensive coconut note,quite nutty,hint of maple syrup and roastiess.
Appearance:black color,quickly-dissapearing brown head.
Taste:sweet,flavour of coconut,milk chocolate,maple syrup,fudge and chocolate,roasty finish,rather sweet roasty aftertaste.
Palate:full body,thick creamy mouhtfeel,low carboantion,a bit boozy.
Overall: Perfect showcase of Omnipollos style dark beer,thick body, intensive aroma and rich uber sweet taste, Im strongly impressed considering a fact that its not made with any artificial flavours whatsoever, PUT IT INTO BARRELS !!!

Pours pitch black with very little head. Nose is typical Omnipollo bonkers with nice maple and almost something along the lines of blueberry muffin and butterscotch. Awsome nose! The taste is also very cakey but less rich than the nose suggest. Still I find this richer than NOA and slightly better.
Jeśli tutaj nie ma grama aromatów to naprawdę szacun. Piwo ze świetną pełnią genialnie wykleja usta zapach miażdży. Za bardzo alko wychodzi w smaku żeby było idealnie

33cl bottle. Thanks Kuba! Aroma is chocolate, caramel. Some maple sweetness. Taste is sweet and rich. Bitter chocolate, toffee, whatever is inside of butterfinger candy bar, actually really similar to yellow belly. Was hoping for more coconut, but tasty as is.
Bottle. Pours opaque black with almost no head. Aroma of coconut and vanilla. Taste of toasted hazeluts, coconut. Nice
[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Black. Coconut, chocolate, nuts, roast, caramel, maple, sweet, full-bodied.

9th February 2017Level 42 Bottleshare. Big thanks to Dave. 
Opaque black  brown beer, decent tan head. Smooth palate, mildly dry, reasonable fine carbonation. Rich toffee and dark chocolate malts. Mild spice. Modest dark fruits. Smooth vanilla. Smooth finish. Nice desert stout, but oddly better when cooler, got a bit chewy on reaching room temperature.

330ml bottle shared with Stuu666. Pours black with a thin beige head. Aromas of coconut, peanut, light maple syrup and toffee. Reminds me of a bag of Revels. Marathon bar taste (snickers). Faint coffee. Maybe thinner than Id have liked, but cracking stuff.

Couldnt finish this. Completely synthetic taste and aroma - sweetness is completely overblown and artificial tastes sit right on top and disrupt anything decent that could be said about the beer. An absolute trainwreck and further proof to me that I should never touch anything with Sirens name on it. Bonus points for that bangin bottle though.

(330ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours pitch black with a small pale brown head and spotty lace. Aroma is extremely sweet and dessert-like, heavy maple syrup notes, dark confectionery chocolate and coffee, light toasty notes, subtle coconut, and some donut batter. Flavour is also quite sweet to start with maple syrup, thick dark malts, quite a lot of toasted notes without deep roast, vanilla and coconut notes behind, a bit of donut batter to the base. Dries out a lot on the finish, some alcohol heat and subtle coffee beans, slight metallic tang. Dry aftertaste. Rather full bodied, viscous and oily with soft carbonation. A bit of the artificial sensation typical of Omnipollo stouts, but the dry finish makes it less cloying than several recent efforts.

Bottle. Black in color with a nice tan head. Coffee and chocolatey fudge in aroma at first. Syrupy sweetness and some vanilla later on. Quite nice, smooth and creamy. Cocoa and milk chocolatey in taste. Bit on the sweeter side, but as a dessert this is alright. Some bitter notes in the end saves it.
330 ml. shared bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, coconut, and caramel. Taste is milk chocolate, coconut, vanilla, caramel, coffee, and a bit of maple. Delicious.

February 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square, with big thanks to Daveman Willis. As Omnipollo Lorelei, 10.5%. Oily black pour, opaque with a small foamy brown head. Aroma is huge with lots of marzipan, peanuts, toasted nuts, vanilla and icecream. Body is smooth with tingly carbonation. Taste is peanut icecream, vanilla, mixed nuts with maple syrup coating, yeasty with a spicy metallic finish. Rich. I can see what people like about it but I find it a bit crazy. Reminds me a bit of Buxtons Yellow Belly, which is another beer I struggle with a bit. Not sure how much of this I could drink. If you like big sweet flavours, this is a must. Maybe I should try it again to be certain. (3.5)

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium creamy brown head. Smell: sweet caramel and roasted malt, vanilla and sweet oily taste, marshmallow. Amazing palate and taste. Good attenuation, caramel and creamy. Aftertaste: roasted malt, vanilla and sweet notes. Oily sensation. Wow!

On tap at HOTD. Colour....onpketely black with a massive brown head. Nose...redolent of toasted coconut and maple, with dark chocolate and molasss as well. Palate...a titch thin but sharp and full of flavour. The cocoanut is prevalent along with butter brickle, dark Scottish toffee and Mapleine. Theres a tannic feel and a tanginess at the back and a long dry finish.

A fantastic maple syrup beer. Pours a beautiful deep black with a brown head. Smells of maple syrup and cake. Taste is thick with cake, coconut, and lots of maple syrup in the finish. Had on tap at Hair of the Dog.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at hotd. Pours a pitch black color with a small brown head. A big sugary coffee, lactose nose. The flavor is big cocoa, roast, sugary, lactose. Milky. Huge. Very good. Maybe too sweet but great.

Bottle big thanks to Wingmane. It pours jet black with a medium tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, soft, sweet, rich chocolate, chocolate cake, toasted coconut, bounty bar, earth and toffee. The taste is slick, sweet, chocolate cake, toasted coconut, coffee, dark cocoa action, slick, warming alcohol, spicy, earth and wood with slick, chocolate finish. Full body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Rich and decadent. Good fun, even though its sweet.

Bottle split at L42, thanks to Dave Wingmane, 09/02/17.
Black with a good sized tan cap.
Nose is melted toffee, coconut, spice, chocolate, sweet tones, marshmallow.
Taste comprises toffee, chocolate melt, light spice, gooey sweetness but balanced, light coconut, faint roast.
Medium + body, fine carboantion, semi drying close with a balanced boost.
Sweet and sticky but fun stuff and an easy drinker without becoming cloying.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared on Level 42 09/2017. Many thanks to Wingman Dave for this one. An oily dark brown black coloured pour with a loose dark tan head. Aroma is sweet praline, toffee, pecan cake, toffee, toasted marshmallow, maple. Lovely. Flavour is composed of super sweet, praline, coconut, maple, pecan and maple pie. Palate is super sweet, velvety, full sticky sweet. Really nice dessert beer.

Bottle share at Level 42. Pours black with laced dirty tan head. Aroma is toast, marshmallow and maple. Taste is maple syrup covered toast with coffee and marshmallow. Smooth carbonation. Lovely but couldnt drink lots

Bottle. Thick black with a small diminishing dark brown head. Pecan pie, hazelnuts, cocoa and fudge in the nose. The flavour has pecan pie, fudge, hazelnuts, chocolate and cocoa. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium/heavy sweet and bitter. Chocolate and fudge in the finish. I dont get any coconut or maple syrup, to me it tastes like the regular Noa.
Un cervezón que lo tiene todo lo que se pide a una de su estilo. Cuerpo, aroma, sabor, alcohol equilibrado. Para mi gusto, una auténtica maravilla.

Bottle from systembolaget. 
Pours black with a tan head. 
Aroma of nuttella and iced coffee drink. 
Sweet, chocolate, coconut and some coffee.

Bottle from systembolaget 
Dark black, brown head
Aroma of lovely chocolate, coconut, coffee, cherry
Taste sweet, round coffee chocolate, coconut. 
Some alcoholic taste. Quite balanced.
Flaska systembolaget. Svart kulör. Söt och kakig doft. Choklad, vanilj, kaffe och lite julkryddor. Rostad smak med mörk choklad, sirap, mocha och mycket kokos.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark colour beer with a creamy brown head. Roasted malts with coconut, chocolate, vanilla and maple. Dry velvety finish.

Bottle. Little Leeds Beer House. Nearly black. No head. Slow and viscous. Nose is rich, sweet chocolate spread. 
Well toasted coconut. Caramel fudge. Roasted chocolate malts. As far as dessert beers go, this smells fantastic. Taste is chocolatey, fudge, coconut sweet. That fades quite quickly, leaving a woody, roast bitterness. Mouthfeel is less full or as smooth as the aroma might suggest, which might not necessarily be a bad thing. Same goes for the finish which gets roasty and slightly woody bitter. Doesnt entirely come together, for me.
@ Bjällerödsvägen 31/1-17. Bottle from Systembolaget. Roasted malty with coconut, chocolate and vanilla, also sweet. Body is full, the finish is roasted with coconut, chocolate and vanilla.
Svart med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter maplesyrup, søt lakris, kaffe, havre og mørk sjokolade... helt fantastisk. Middels fylde. Søtlig, maplesyrup, mørk sjokolade og søt lakris. Lett bitterhet.

@ Havregatan 20170201. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty, chocolate, coconut, vanilla, sweet, full body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter, roasted and sweet with chocolate, coconut and some alcohol.

February 1, 2017. 
Black with a medium sized, dense but quickly dissipating brown head. Aroma is quite intense maple syrup, caramel, vanilla, coconut, 
Taste is quite intense sweet and bitter. Full bodied, creamy texture, slightly astringent. Finish is bitter ark roast on top on a sweet sticky toffee, maple syrup and vanilla base. 
As with other Omnipollo stouts its all about the adjuncts, would prefer a better balance between the base and the adjuncts.

Pitch black color, small brown head. Lovely aromas of chocolate, lactose, cookie dough, coconut, toffee and caramel sauce with a slight artificial feel to it. Sweet taste of sugar, coconut, alcohol, caramel and wood with a slight chemical taste during the finish. Overall a great beer!
Svart öl med ett ljusbrunt skum. Doft och smak av choklad, kaffe, karamell, kola, kokos och alkohol. Som en kärleksmums med alkohol. Alkoholen något för framträdande för ett högre betyg.
33cl bottle. pitch black color. almost no foam. vanilla (ice cream) coconut, a bit sweet,

330ml bottle pours out black topped with a ring of a tan head. Nose is amazing French toast big coconut maple syrup sweet milk chocolate. Taste is more of the French toast maple syrup milk chocolate vanilla bourbon.
Black with a small tan head. Candy aroma of milk chocolate, vanilla, coconut and sweet licorice. Cloying sweet candy flavour with a touch of roasted malt. Try adding some beer...
Bottle @ Dunkbar. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of cake, lactose sugar, loads of toffee, nougat. Overly sweet, roasty, coffee, choko and quite bitter.

33 cl bottle from SB. Awesome bottle design, Omnipollo stands out as always. Pours pitch black as expected, looks oily, almost no head. Aroma of coconut, syrup, almond, maple syrup, lovely toasted sweet aroma. Mouthfeel is really creamy oily thick. Sweet frikkin awesome.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. APPEARANCE: pitch-black with a medium brown head. NOSE: strong aroma of roasted malt, bitter chocolate, vanilla, coconut, mocha, brown sugar, light fruity hopiness. TASTE: very sweet, long and bitter aftertaste. Well hidden alcohol. MOUTH: medium to full body, with a sticky texture.
Keg at Omnipollos Hatt. Pours deep brown with a slight brown head which soon recedes. Aroma is caramel and coconut. Taste is cocoa bitter, caramel sweet, coconut. Bordering on cloyingly sweet.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2017 Bottle. Black beer with small brown head. Aroma of milk chocolate, coconut, fudge, some maple syrup and dark fruits. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter, like bounty bar (chocolate and coconut) with maple syrup, toffee, some smoke and roasted, nutty finish. Nearly full bodied, oily, with soft carbonation. Wonderful dessert porter, but maybe a little too sweet.

Another bottle shared at tasting. Yes, it is slightly too sweet and also overcarbonated this time.

Ne tient pas tout à fait toutes ses promesses selon moi. Mais ça reste du très lourd. Nez ultra gourmand : très biscuit, crumble, noisette, chocolat au lait et blanc. Bouche : très douce, très chocolat, noisette, biscuit, un fond assez torréfié. Longueur très équilibrée, assez fine mais bien aromatique.
On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Black with a creamy tan head. Sweet with coconut, chocolate, nuts, fudge and some warming alcohol. The mouthfeel was kind of sticky.

Bottled. pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, coconut and vanilla. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Porter🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle shared at Maakuns. Black with tan head. Deep roasted sweet chocolate malts and big sweet maple and very big nutty body. Very sweet and mild nutty bitter. Liquid candybar. Milk chocolate. A Lion bar and a Bounty fused together. Full body and soft carbonation. Very sweet chocolate and nutty finish. Mocca, cinnamon buns and pecan coffee rolls. Very smooth and soft.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Black with small light brown head. Lots of roasted notes, fudge, toffee, roasted coconut, maple syrup, dark chocolate. Basically lots of sweet chocolate based desert notes. No fruits or anything, just thick sweet imperial porter with the adjuncts. Very sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied with slick feel.

Bottle at home, poured a oily black colour with a dark mocha head with Some Nice legs on the Side. Big hit of sweet maple goodness, sticky salty caramel, big fudge, vanilla Cream, chocolate, pralines, and a light artificial sweetness, lacking of coconut in the nose, whished it was dominant in here, so thats a let down. Taste of sweet maple, quite Some carbonation, bitter chocolate, char and more artificial notes. Not as good as the nose. Quite a let down.

Draught. Opaque black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of vanilla crackers, red berries, chocolate, light coffee and light raw sugar. Taste is very sweet and light bitter with notes of vanilla crackers, red berries, raw sugar and chocolate. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Soo sweet. Why do you want to give us diabetes, Henok?

A: Pitch black with a deep dark brown head that dissapates fast N: Vanilla, maple, hazelnut, coconut, almond, marshmallow T: Coffee, maple, bitter chocolate, almond O: Quite boozy and was expecting far more coconut to it. Still decent even though its a bit artificial...

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 Pitch black with a thin brown head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla and loads of cookies and coconut with slightly roasted undertone. Taste wise this is just an amazing beer! A desert on its own with a big explosion of sweet tastes. Full body and soft carbonation. Almost as good as the pecan muddcake version.

Draught at the brewery, 11/28-11/30/16.Dark black, inky body of indeterminable clarity topped by a medium sized, charred-tan head of moderate retention.Pungent roast, dark fruits and char mostly keep the coconut character to a minimum. I really have a very low tolerance for the stuff in most beverages, finding it to massively dominate when not used very carefully. Here its quite light in the nose and theres plenty of enjoyable burnt and vinous character that really balances the cocoa and caramel fudge-like maltiness nicely.Same in the mouth, though its exceedingly rich, the oily, burnt notes and light coconut help balance all of this malt. Coffee, caramel, char and prunes with low carbonation (but ample). Coconut, caramel, char and dark fruits linger. Alcohol pretty strong here and as the stuff warms and breathes, it gets pretty challenging due to all of the sugar/syrup character.  Still, I do like the overall flavor distribution, if the mouthfeel and attenuation could be done better.
AIBF2016. Black pour with a creamy dark mocha head. Maple bounty bar with vanillin nose. Heavy sweet and bitter taste. Round, viscous, astringent mouthfeel. Nice dessert but a bit artificial.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with very small, light brown head. Aroma are cookies and cream, coconut, chocolate, some roasted accents. Taste is highly sweet and moderate bitter in the end, long-lasting, stable. Rather highly drinkable, Podsumowanie: Deser waniliwo-czekoladowy, ciasteczka, lody śmietankowe, kokos, trochę krówkowate, jakieś tam toffee, finish goryczkowy, lekko rozgrzewający. Dobra razed, zdecydowanie.
Bottle at home. Pous black, the aroma is intense - caramel, chocolate, maple syrup, cake, light coconut, taste is rich, chewy caramel and chocolate, gentle coconut, light maple syrup, bitter finish.
Sampel butelki w Chmielarni. Mocno czekoladowy aromat, mleczna czekolada, Brownie. Smak słodki, cudownie czekoladowy, jak płynny deser. Mocno zajebista rzecz.
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of coconut, maple, toffee, tonka. Taste is sweet, sugary, mild chocolate finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lion. Zwart met een donkere bruine kraag heerlijk vol met siroop koffie en note. wederom fantastisch bier van dit huis.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 PostpanelRami Rami is drinking a Lorelei by Omnipollo at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaWyrob cukierniczy wysokiej klasy :) i z fajna faktura w uscie, umiejoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle from Beergium. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coconut, chocolate, toffee, coffee, syrup, a bit of nuts and vanilla. Bitter finish with roasted malts, coconut, coffee, syrup, chocolate, nuts and vanilla. Exquisite imperial stout.

Bottle.Pours black with almost no head.Sweet aroma of cookies and coconut.Overwhelmingly sweet taste, needed a more "beer" profile than the total desert in a bottle that it is.The mouthfeel though is textbook porter.If it wasnt such a sugarbomb it would be a better beer.

Pitch black with mocha head. Aroma has cookies, ice cream, vanilla and chocolate. Taste follows with the dessert flavors like sweet vanilla cookies and ice cream. Finish is slightly roasty and bitter. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation. Overall its another great dessert stout from Omnipollo.
33cl bottle shared at home. Pitch black with a small tan head. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Nice sweetness with subtle bitter tones. Chocolate, coffee, toffee and coconut. Very good.

Nose very nice coconut cacao and milk chocolate. Taste beautifully follows the aroma. Cocoa dominates. Subtle lactose sweetness and breadiness in the background. Aftertaste could be better but for imp. Porter this is very good.
Sweet maple syrup, vanilla ice cream, chocolate and a some coffee on the finish. Pretty awesome

Bottle shared. Pours pitch black with small dense dark brown head. Aromas of sweet maple, vanilla icecream, light coconut, sweet chocolate, fudge. Taste is sweet, fudge, vanilla, chocolate, light heat, light toasted coconut, sweet maple, roasty bitterness in the back. Tastes close to Noa. Subtle difference. Still good though.

33cl bottle at home. Pitch black pour with a dense espresso head that is slow to rise to the surface. Tons of maple syrup in the aroma, together with burnt caramel and a bit of vanilla. The taste notes include dark chocolate, maple syrup, roasted malts, some roasted coffee and very subtle toasted coconut (the bitter part of toasted coconut, I guess you could call it).Full body, low carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Another great dessert beer from Onmipollo.

Apperance: Dark as the night with a creamy, beige, head.
Aroma: Coconut, Maple Syrup, Toffee, Vanilla.
Taste: Coconut, Maple Syrup, Alcohol, Vanilla, hint of nuts.
Palate: Cloyingly sweet with some small trace of bitterness at the end.

Liquid diabetes comes to mind. Why all the residual sugars? There is no balance to this whatsoever.

Kolor czarny z ciemnobeżową pianą. W aromacie słodka czekolada, praliny z likierowym nadzieniem, wanilia, kokos, orzeszki, rodzynki (pojawiły się po ogrzaniu). Pachnie po prostu jak jakiś ekskluzywny deser. W smaku gorzka kawa, delikatny szlachetny alkohol, gorzka czekolada, wanilia, jest też posmak kokosowo- orzechowy. Nie miałem nigdy styczności z syropem klonowym, także nie potrafię określić, czy on występuje w piwie czy nie. Lorelei jest bardzo gęste, likierowe, w aromacie słodkie, w smaku bardziej gorzkie, chociaż słodycz też występuje. Piwo bardzo dobre, ale myślę że jak trochę poleży i się ułoży to będzie petarda.
Very nice. Very subtle coconut in the taste, more of the maple syrup, roasted, nice bitterness. Very good!!

Bottle from Beer Revolution courtesy of Isobel (cheers Isobel!), Hay on Wye, Powys consumed at Isobels, Eardisley, Herefordshire Sunday 25th, Christmas Day, December 2016   Black as yer at with a beige head its creamy textured. Creamy with a little nuttiness and coffee, indulgent, smooth, creamy with a steady but non intrusive heat the alcohol. Really thick in the mouth, great beer, toasty, bready, yummy.  A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov16 3.9
Keg at Heaton Hops. Black with a small brown head. Big maple aroma with coconut in there. Big, thick, boozy sweet taste with chocolate and maple. Tasty stuff indeed.
Woow. Potężny aromat. Niesamowite praliny, orzechy, kokos, wanilia. Słodkie, oblepiające, na finiszu gorzka czekolada z orzechami, trochę w stylu Noa Pecan. Cudowne piwo.

Fra fat på Omnipollos Hatt 26 Nov 16. Kullsort. Pent brunt tett skum. Stablit. Kraftig aroma av kokosnøtt og sjokolade. Litt lacing. Smaken vanilje. Blir litt tørr etter hvert. Utmerket - men blir litt uvariert.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 Keg at the Bottle Shop Bermondsey - London. Pours black-brown with a creamy, tan head. Big aroma, lots of creamy toffee, cocoa, vanilla, some nutty notes. Hugely sweet flavorbwith syrupy sugars, brown sugar, maple syrup, mild earthy bitterness, more toffee. Full bodied, thick and oily, with fine carbonation. Warming and sticky in the finish, with some salted caramel, coffee ice cream, coffee, gooey maple syrup. Really fun in a dumb adjunct kind of way. (December 2016, score: 3.9)Re-visited in bottle and liked it a lot more. Better rounded. Less cloying. (February 2016, score: 4.2)

Keg at the Bottle Shop, Bermondsey. It pours a pitch black color with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet and rich in vanilla pecans chocolate and cookie dough. Taste is also sweet with more notes of adjuncts, vanilla pecans cocoa milk chocolate. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice but sweet
Tap at omnipollos hatt, stockholm. Black color, tanned head. Aroma has coffee, toffee, some burnt sugar. Balanced roasty body, smooth, toffee, coffee. Not enough co2 but ok.

200ml draught at Omnipollos Hatt. Jet black body, dissipating tan-coloured head. Clingy lacing. Coconut and chocolate nose. Vanilla chocolate and coconuts to the taste buds followed by a long-lived finish with some impact of coffee. Full bodied. Pleasing, just a tad too sweet in the long run (Stockholm 25.11.2016).
@ Hatten 16-11-28: Klibbig vätska med tydlig ton av kokos och nötter. Ganska söt men inte så illa.

Svart.
Lukt: lönnsirap, sirap, choklad, rostad kokos, 9
Smak: pecankola, rostad kokos, knäck, sen lite syrlig för att landa i choklad, nötig.
Väldigt god!

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Black with creamy beige head. Aroma of coconut, toffee and maple syrup. Aggressively sweet with full body and sticky mouthfeel. Loads of coconut and toffee, plenty of sticky syrup. Diesel, alcohol and ink in a brutal finish. A train wreck.
Draught at All in Beer Fest 2016 session 3, 2016-11-05 Göteborg AR: oily chocolate, AP: dark brown, no head F: fudge, oily chocolate, nutty 3,9
Lots and lots of dark chocolate, leaving a sweet taste of syrup and coffee. Absolutly great.

On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Pours intense black with a low compact creamy tan head. Aromas of vanilla, coconut, maple syrup, lactose, chocolate, muscovado sugar, roasted nuts, roasted malt. Taste is quite sweet with lightly roasted notes and chocolate. Mouthfeel is creamy and luxurious and the aftertaste just lingers forever on a cloud of maple chocolatey awesomeness!

How: Draught.
Where: All in Beerfest 2016.
Appearance: Black colour with a tan head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, coconut, chocolate, some coffee.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Coconut, chocolate, some alcohol, roasted malt, some coffee.
Sample at All In Beer Fest. Black with tan head. Aroma and taste of roasted coconut, chocolate, light coffee, roast and a bit of boozy sweetness.
Sample at All In Beer Fest 2016. Black with tanned head. Roasted coconut, chocolate, light coffee and roasted malt. Nice and thick. Sweet with big body low to medium carbonation.

Fat på All In Beer Fest, Göteborg. Svart med högt brunt skum. Stor doft av rostad kokos, chokladkaka, jordnöt, lönnsirap. Alldeles lagom stor kropp. Chokladkaka, rostad kokos, bara en gnutta alkoholvärme, fina nötiga toner och sötma från lönnsirap. En perfekt Omnipollo IS.
